p: To date, studies conducted on EA have demonstrated the efficacy of the plant as a sedative and diaphoretic, and also a treatment for cough, sore throat and pneumonia [ 12, 13]. Cyanidin 3-glucoside, the most common anthocyanin found in the petals of EA, has had neuroprotective effects and has traditionally been used as an anxiolytic and antidepressant medicine in Asia [ 14].
